We tend to let the group decide what works best for them. If the communication you are doing is something that you want to be more easily searchable or something where you think threading is useful, then the mailing lists make more sense.

Hi everyone, my name is Fabiano Franz and I'm the country director for World Vision Timor-Leste. It's great to be part of this group and re-connect with those I had the privilege to meet last December in Basel.
Glad to see you @fabianovf

@Chris_BlockImpact Projects are definitely interesting as well, but a debate amongst the group about what's wrong with charitable donations and how blockchain could apply would be interesting....feel free to add it to a future meeting agenda or mailing list topic!

The problem with charitable donations is lack of transparency in the whole process. 
Organization like WHO or Redcross have to depend on local NGO entities in respective countries where WHO doesn't have any footprint. Trusting the LOCAL NGO will give the donated assets is one problem which I see.
@Pradeep_Pentakota Yes, the giant nonprofits should take the first step:) https://blockimpact.tech/2019/02/12/human-blockchain-3-blockchain-can-sweep-the-dust-off-philanthropy/

Has joined the channel.

I just came across this opportunity to share your use case to be potentially included in an upcoming report by the U.N. International Telecommunication Union (ITU). Please see the message below and links for details on submissions. The deadline is March 29th.

Also keep an eye out for an upcoming meeting invite soon!

========
I am a member of ITU Focus Group on Application of Distributed Ledger Technology (FG DLT). ITU is the United Nations’ specialized agency for information and communication technology.

Over the last year, the Focus Group has been collecting DLT use to compose its technical deliverables. You can see a past call for input at https://news.itu.int/inviting-blockchain-use-cases/.

Moving ahead, we are focusing on collecting use cases, which have at least a proof of concept, and are not yet covered in our use case collection.

I would like to invite you to submit your initiative’s use case for consideration by the group. If you are interested, please submit your input using the template available at https://www.itu.int/en/ITU-T/focusgroups/dlt/Documents/FG_DLT-Use_case_template.docx. The deadline for document submission for this meeting is 29 March 2019, but the sooner the submission, the bigger the probability of feedbacks from experts. 

More information about the focus group is available at https://www.itu.int/en/ITU-T/focusgroups/dlt/Pages/default.aspx.

​======

Dear Social Impact SIG community,

We are back from a mini-hiatus and you may have seen that we have a new meeting time established, bi-weekly on Tuesdays at 10am EST starting with the next meeting on April 2nd. I include the dial in details below. Here is how you can get the calendar invite added to your personal calendar:
1. Visit the Hyperledger Calendar of Public Meetings
2. Find the next Social Impact SIG meeting on April 2nd, click on it and you'll see a link "copy to my calendar", click on that link and it will open a separate window or download the invite. If you have any questions, let me know.

Call for Agenda Items
Our group is an open forum for anyone to participate in and contribute to, is there anything you'd like to share or discuss or propose the group work on? Please let me know and I'll get it added to the agenda for next week and share that around on prior to the call.

We've had quite a few new subscribers to our mailing list in the past few weeks, so we hope you will introduce yourselves in the call or here online and share with us your interest and what you're working on.

I look forward to connecting with you all again soon and seeing what updates you have for us.

Dear SI-SIG Community,

Thank you for your input here is the agenda and meeting details for our next call:
Introductions: Who's new to the group or call? Let's get to know each other and what we're working on in the 'blockchain for impact' world
Presentation: Charity Management project by Pradeep Pentakota from goodchar. Track every penny/asset at the last mile digitally and record the donated asset transactions immutably by using Hyperledger functionalities.
Proposal: SIG Survey to learn more about what everyone wants to get from the working group.
Admin: Wiki walk through
Miscellaneous: Share any comments, ideas, announcements, upcoming events
As always, please feel free to engage outside of our calls on this mailing list, chat, or the wiki.

Thank you for everyone who attended the last call, and a big thank you to Leila Yosef who lead the call. If anyone else would like to take a hand at leading a future call, please just let me know!

Recap
Please find the meetings notes and recording from the discussion from July 9th: https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/SISIG/2019-07-09+Meeting+notes​

I would like to especially highlight that we are conducting a survey of the community to determine our goals and priorities. Please complete the survey at this link by 5pm EST Tuesday, July 23rd.

​Agenda​
N​ext week, we will have Christina Lomazzo, Blockchain Lead at UNICEF presenting on their blockchain activities and projects​--thanks for joining us Christina! You can find the agenda for our next meeting here: https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/SISIG/2019-07-23+Meeting+notes

We have openings in September for presentations so please reach out if you'd like to share what you're working on.

​Talk soon!
Karen​​

Has joined the channel.

The Sovrin Foundation is pleased to share with you our new white paper examining identification management systems in the humanitarian sector that use distributed ledger technology (DLT). 

Humanitarian assistance is increasingly managed and delivered remotely via digitized administrative and operational systems that center on “beneficiary management” software to manage the identification of individuals being served. Specifically, this report analyzes systems that use DLT to perform these functions, offering insight into their potential benefits and risks. It assesses arguments for and against the use of DLT-based systems and digs into the implications, for individuals and institutions, of shifting to a distributed paradigm. https://sovrin.org/dlt-based-identification-in-the-humanitarian-sector/
*SIG Chair Election*

We are now requesting expressions of interest for the Social Impact SIG Chair position. Anyone who is a member of this SIG can nominate themselves for SIG Chair.
If you would like to express your interest in this role please send the following by Tuesday, August 13th at 12pm EST to kottoni@linuxfoundation.org: 

Name
Email
Title, company
LinkedIn page link
200 words on why you would like to be chair and what your commitment and vision for the SIG will be.
We also shared the results from our survey which I would encourage any candidates to review as you prepare your submission. You can find it in our meeting notes. SIG Chair responsibilities were shared in our previous meeting 2019-07-23 Meeting notes

Once we have a group of interested candidates, their submissions will be posted on our wiki for all SIG members to review along with instructions on how to submit votes. 

If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to me directly.

image.png
Dear SI-SIG Community,

Recap
Thank you to Matthew Davie from Kiva for a really interesting presentation on the exciting work that Kiva is doing to bring financial inclusion to communities around the world. I strong encourage you to watch the recording and check out the slides if you missed it!

Another key presentation from this last call was the results of our survey. If you have not seen the results please review the slides and join our call this Tuesday because we will be continuing the discussion on next steps, including deciding what our work products will be and who would like to work on which topic (see topics in survey slides). If you cannot make the call on Tuesday, please indicate by email what you're interested in contributing to so that we can count you in.

Please find the meetings notes, slides, and recording from the discussion from August 6th: https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/SISIG/2019-08-06+Meeting+notes

​Agenda​
This week, we have Cornelius Saunders, Program Manager at ID2020 presenting on their digital identity activities and projects​.
You can find the agenda for our next meeting here: https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/SISIG/2019-08-20+Meeting+notes

We have openings in September & October for presentations so please reach out if you'd like to share what you're working on. Or feel free to add yourself to the list! https://wiki.hyperledger.org/display/SISIG/SI+-+Community+Presentations

As always, you can find the key info for our group below, including the call time and zoom, and how to add the meeting to your calendar.​

Talk soon,
Karen​​


SI-SIG Key Info

1. Visit the Hyperledger Calendar of Public Meetings
2. Find the next Social Impact SIG meeting, click on it and you'll see a link "copy to my calendar", click on that link and it will open a separate window or download the invite. If you have any questions, let me know.

Hi everyone,

My name is Adrian founder of GST. We are a global tech community in 35+ countries and we have partnered with the Hyperledger community in the past to make connections worldwide.

I just had a chat with David Boswell, and he mentioned you guys are doing webinars for the community and present projects and/or startups relating to Social impact blockchain solutions.

Now, I’m reaching out because we are interested in helping those projects connect with the right partners in multiple new markets for the purpose of scaling up, finding sales, and distribution channels.

We do this through a matching engine by matching real-world organizational problems with solutions. We would love and get more data on those projects here. Check out this post https://medium.com/globalsouthtech/looking-for-teams-startups-and-projects-to-help-them-scale-up-bce9497eadfa

I would love to engage further with this group and explore collaborations if any comments please just let me know

Thanks a lot
Adrian
